templates.astext: Mary ran _int:4~10_ miles everyday for _int:2~5_ weeks. How many miles did she run in total?
John cycled _int:4~10_ miles every day for _int:2~5_ weeks. How many miles did he cycle in total?
Sarah had $_int:35~85_.00 in her bank account. She withdrew $_int:100~130_.00 and deposited $_int:1~14_.00. How much does she owe?
David had $_int:35~85_.00 in his bank account. He withdrew $_int:100~130_.00 and deposited $_int:5~45_.00. How much money does he have in his account now?
Jane earned _int:2~4_X as much money as her friend Mark, plus an additional $_double:11.25~20.5_ from a side job. If Jane earned a total of $_double:130.1~168.9_, how much did Mark earn?
Carlos has some marbles. If he divides them equally among _int:3~6_ friends, each friend gets _int:6~18_ marbles. How many marbles does Carlos have in total?

Tom bought a total of _int:20~80_ pens and pencils. Each pen costs $_double:1.25~2.75_ and each pencil costs $_double:0.1~0.99_. He spent a total of $_double:80.0~120.0_. How many pens did he buy? (Truncate your answer to the next lowest integer)

Sally bought a total of _int:20~80_ apples and bananas. Each apple costs $_double:1.25~2.75_ and each banana costs $_double:0.1~0.99_. She spent a total of $_double:80.0~120.0_. How many apples did she buy? (Truncate your answer to the next lowest integer)

Rebecca loves to read books. On Monday, she reads _sequence:pos=1&initial=1~20&scale=5~10_ pages. On Tuesday, she reads _sequence:pos=2&initial=1~20&scale=5~10_ pages. On Wednesday, she reads _sequence:pos=3&initial=1~20&scale=5~10_ pages. She continued this pattern for _int:5~10_ days. How many pages did Rebecca read in total?

Daniel loves solving puzzles. On Monday, he solves _sequence:pos=1&initial=3~7&scale=2~7_ puzzles. On Tuesday, he solves _sequence:pos=2&initial=3~7&scale=2~7_ puzzles. On Wednesday, he solves _sequence:pos=3&initial=3~7&scale=2~7_ puzzles. He continued this pattern for _int:4~8_ days. How many puzzles did Daniel solve in total?
A rectangular garden has an area of _int:100~180_ square meters. The length of the garden is _int:3~7_ meters longer than its width. Find the dimensions of the garden.
A rectangular plot of land has an area of _int:100~180_ square meters. The width of the plot is _int:5~9_ meters longer than its length. Find the dimensions of the plot.

The cook at a local restaurant that serves primarily pizza was wondering what sizes of pizza he should offer at his place. He conducted a survey and the top three choices came to be
A. a pizza with a radius of _int:3~18_ inches,
B. a pizza with a diameter of _int:3~18_ inches
C. a pizza with the circumference of _int:3~18_ inches.
Which pizza (A/B/C) is ranked _string:1st,2nd,3rd_ when ranked from _string:least to greatest,greatest to least_ area?

A circular trampoline has a unique property: the ratio of its area to its circumference is equal to _int:4~50_. Determine the radius of the trampoline. (Assume Ï€ is 3.14, and round to the nearest tenth)
The area of a circle is equal to its circumference. Determine the radius of the circle.
A triangular garden has a base of _int:10~50_ meters and a height of _int:10~70_ meters. Calculate the area of the garden.

A flagpole casts a shadow that is _int:10~20_ meters long on level ground. The angle of elevation from the tip of the shadow to the top of the flagpole is _int:45~90_ degrees. Determine the height of the flagpole.

A ladder leaning against a wall forms a right triangle with the ground. The ladder's length is _int:10~20_ ft, and the distances from the ground to the top and bottom of the ladder are equal. What is the distance from the ground to the bottom of the ladder?
Calculate the surface area of a sphere with radius _int:1~10_ units.
Find the volume of a sphere with diameter _int:1~10_ units.
Determine the side length of a cube with volume _int:1~10_ cubic units.
Calculate the surface area of a cube with edge length _int:1~10_ units.
Find the volume of a cylinder with diameter _int:4~16_ units and height _int:6~18_ units.
Determine the lateral surface area of a cylinder with radius _int:2~8_ units and height _int:5~15_ units.
Find the volume of a triangular pyramid with base area _int:5~25_ square units and height _int:3~12_ units.
Calculate the total surface area of a square pyramid with base side length _int:1~15_ units and slant height _int:5~20_ units.
Perform the following operations and simplify: ( _int:1~10_ + _int:2~11_i) + ( _int:1~9_ - _int:2~11_i)
Calculate i^_int:2~10_
